channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bricks dumped in street and council is doing nothing, 27th October
item.description:
The same issue was reported around 6 weeks ago and multiple times since then and is consistently being ignored by the council - why? This waste is blocking the road, making it difficult for cars to pass each other and blocking a parking space. I am happy to keep on reporting the issue until it is properly resolved.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dyne Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Rosendale Road SE21 outside Lairdale Estate about te, 27th October
item.description:
Rosendale Road SE21 outside Lairdale Estate about ten yards south of streetlight column ID number 74 is green power coated metal Lambeth cycle locker which is graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor re attached picture (which shows main double entrance gates for Rosendale Primary School entrance in the back ground and Google Streetview link which shows location but not the cycle locker as this is new: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4461252,-0.0988552,3a,60y,207.12h,87.69t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1s-trRssjvF9WQo3HFszR8zA!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D2.3071086706237196%26panoid%3D-trRssjvF9WQo3HFszR8zA%26yaw%3D207.116856745347!7i13312!8i6656?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTAyMi4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coaldale Walk, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken paving/tiling - block 19 Devon Mansions, 27th October
item.description:
Outside the front of Block 19 Devon Mansions on Tooley Street - Metal rim and lots of tiling now loose and broken leaving dangerous surface and bare ground underneath - more tiles breaking each day as they are not secured down

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tooley Street, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light Corner of Grasmere Road and Highland Road, 27th October
item.description:
The light from this street light is blocked by trees of the property on the corner of Grasmere and Highland Road, keeping the area that should be lit, in the dark. Work was recently done to cut back branches of the same trees interfering with telephone lines and the branches covering the street light could have been cleared at the same time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cameron House, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post code Br1 4ba Street lamp number G315 opposite 14 and 16 Grasmere Road, 27th October
item.description:
For the last few weeks at least, this lamp does not come on with the other street lights when it gets dark. It does come on intermittently after around 22.00hrs for a period but goes off again. This part of Grasmere Road is in darkness for most of the time it is dark.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grasmere Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Debris from road traffic collision outside the off licence on Saturday evening, 27th October
item.description:
There is a large amount of vehicle debris on the road and pavement from an RTC which happened on Saturday evening. The debris includes glass from headlights/ rear lights and sharp pieces of plastic from bumpers. It will cause harm to passing vehicle tyres and pedestrians if not removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackfen Road, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electricity box lid hanging dangerously off, 27th October
item.description:
The metal lid for this electricity box on the side of the road is hanging off the top and knocked me off my bike, as I went past it caught my arm. I went into the Tesco and on my way back looked at it again and tried to fix it but it was live so I left it. I looked at one more time and thought to myself that’s going to kill someone if that isn’t fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 230, High Road, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
